Description: Base sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; interior: glazed (fired red-brown); exterior: frieze of narrow tongues at base; band in added red on glazed outside and inside of foot; under foot, wide black band at edge with three narrow black bands and dot in centre.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 98-9, no. A143)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.251) (phase 3)
